Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: This hotel could hardly be bettered. Superb condition, friendly and helpful staff, excellent breakfast, ideal location

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kumatta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the S-Bahn station, and easy to get to. It is also very close to the museum island, so this hotel is a very good place if you want to spend lots of time there. The room was not large by any means, but since I was travelling alone on business, it was more than enough. A huge plus was free wireless Internet. Some of the reviews were complaining about noise at night, but I had no problem. The elevator was unconventional, since you need to press the floor that you want to go to outside of the elevator. I only had breakfast once at the hotel because of the cost performance. If you are hungry, I would recommend it, but since I do not eat that much in the morning, it was overpriced for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PR123074
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Berlin but I hope it won't be the last. The hotel was comfartable, friendly and efficient. The room was a good size and well equipped and our request for an extra pillow met straight away. Lovely breakfasts including fresh fruit and freshly cooked eggs and bacon available. The location is excellent - walking distance from most of the sights in the centre, very close to the river, lots of restaurants, cafes and bars as well as shopping opportunities right outside. And a tram stop and underground for exploring further afield. Day tickets are good value and available in reception, along withpostage stamps.

Reviews.Title: “good location and excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Baless
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one nigth at this very central hotel in Berlin. The room are small and the forniture is not very modern but ok for one nigth business trip. At nigth some people shouting in the street awaked me up, but it may happen everywhere in the world. Breakfast is very good and the position is very central so it may be convenient also for a long weekend in town.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: tract13
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms & the best hotel breakfast I have had in years. Very central; very friendly: very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jaardi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located - I arrived by train at the Hauptbahnhof, which is only 2 stops away from Hackescher Markt S-bahn station and from there it's a short walk to the hotel. I was a little troubled when I saw the trams stopped in front of the hotel, but even though my room faced that street, it wasn't terribly noisy. Lots of restaurants and bars nearby and the Hackescher Hoefe shopping complex is just on the corner. Close to everything in Berlin. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, the breakfast waitress was also very friendly. Breakfast was plentiful and varied. Nice hotel - I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and well located hotel with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: John1944
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in this hotel, which was conveniently located for the main museums and for Berlin's excellent transport system. Our room was quiet, comfortable and well equipped. The buffet breakfast was very good and plentiful. The reception staff were unfailingly courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, excellent service. Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moreno132
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located just 2 minutes walk from the Hackescher Markt S-Bahn station which makes the location perfect. I came for business and had meeting in different areas in Berlin so I just used the S-Bahn which is really efficient and fast. The fact that the hotel is located so close to the station saved me a lot of time and money. The staff in the hotel is very friendly and helpful. Room was good, very clean and comfortable. Internet connection was fast and reliable. There is no A/C in the room and it was bit hot even though it was cold outside. Maybe staying in the hotel during summer might be too hot. Breakfast was excellent with rich varieties of food and this includes also very good staff in the dining room that will take care of you.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: tsls02191
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, and another couple stayed for three nights. The Executive Rooms were very good and deserved the four-star marking, as did the breakfast. The staff were excellent and could not do enough to help. The location is very convenient with a five-minute walk to Museum Island or Charlotten Plaz and two minutes from the S-Bahn Station. An ideal and, relatively speaking, affordable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what they advertise”
Reviews.Author: mavrodaphne
Reviews.Content: There is no wireless in rooms - only in bar. The breakfast looked like it would have been good, but I did not eat any because there were flies crawling on the meat and cheese, and the eggs were well undercooked. The room was too hot (I was given a fan, but there is no AC). Aside from that, the room was simple and fine and the location is great. But considering everything, this place is seriously overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “An friendly and comfortable hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Markredfoxx
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on previous reviews on Trip Advisor and we couldn't have been more delighted. It's true the standard rooms are a little small, but how much do you really need on a short city break? We feel it really isn't worth paying extra for facilities you won't use. The hotel is clean and the staff are most helpful and genuinely friendly. Location-wise it is superb. Very close to the S-Bahn station, with many restaurants and bars on a couple of minutes walk away. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel and found several places nearby, all friendly and very reasonable. Don't miss the market outside the station on Thursday and Saturday! We will certainly book this hotel again on future visits and we would be very happy to recommend it to others. For German food try Weinerstephaner by the station, or Mansy on Oranienburger Strasse. For Turkish, try Hasir (also on Oranienburger Strasse). All excellent food, service and price. For Breakfast, try Rocco under the station; the Sunday brunch is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location : beautiful but expensive breakfast !”
Reviews.Author: percynorthants
Reviews.Content: Stayed her 3 nights in snowy Feb. Very convenient central location and reasonable price for rather small room. Down side was shower room fan and heater didn't work and not fixed while we were there : and breakfast while excellent if E15 extra, and there aren't many alternatives nearby - unless you're OK with just coffee. But we didn't need much lunch. Eating try Nikolaviertel - looks very touristy bus reasonable places, too - we loved Kartoffel-Laube (see reviews) for good solid, winter, reasonable food and excellent beer - try the dark beer, it's smooth and just right for these meals.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: RAGAZZA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I we’ve stayed at hackescher hotel for 3 nights – New Year’s Eve 2007/8. This hotel is simply fantastic. The staff is friendly, very professional, ample room and very very good breakfast! The location is great. Restaurants and bars in walking distance, a lot of shops, really it couldn’t be better. Berlin is an amazing city and it was a very good way to begin 2008. So if you visit Berlin (you should!) don’t hesitate and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected lovely staying in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Southwings
Reviews.Content: I 've read a lot of hotel reviews before I chose this one to stay during our 5 days in Berlin (I went there with my parents). This hotel is simply GREAT. The very young staff is too friendly, runs the day by day of the hotel very professionaly. Ample room and very very good breakfast - I've never found such a breakfast in a hotel 3 stars before. The location is superbe, 10 min to Berliner Dom, Bebelptaz, Alexander Platz and Museums island. You may find not so attractive the small street it is located - there is a train stop just in front of it - but, really ? forget it. You will be so well treated, touristic sights will be so near you that it will mean nothing after your so splendid staying in Berlin. The hotel is also quite closer to a metro station so you could come to West side in less than 10 min! Perfect. Berlin was a great and unforgetable surprise and this hotel contributed to it. And more, the hotel is very close to Nikolaiviertel (10 min walking) - a lovely spot where there are a lot of restaurants. An amazing walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Mitte”
Reviews.Author: zagat
Reviews.Content: The smallest rooms are really small. Take a step up and it's worth the extra price, especially if you snag a room that faces the quiet and lovely courtyard, way more peaceful than the street-side entrance, which faces a tram stop. All in all, I liked the hotel, though it lacks personality. The location in Mitte can't be beat - very central, yet also tucked away on a side street, so you are away from the bustle when you leave each morning and return each night. I eventually switched hotels and stayed in Prenzlauer Berg, which seemed more vital and less commercial than what Mitte has become over the past few years, but this being Berlin, I fear P'berg is just a year or two behind....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Klamson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, June 15th - 17th. Hackescher Markt Hotel is ideally located. It's within walking distances of many attractions or you can walk about 1/2 block to the train station. Many restaurants, even Starbucks, are located within a block or so. As is the case with many hotels in Europe, rooms are not air conditioned, but stay here in Winter, Fall, early Summer, or spring. We enjoyed out room on the top floor (there is an elevator) with lovely dormer windows that swing open giving a great breeze. It was hot here during the day but wonderfully cool breeze in the evening and all night. Service was excellent, staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was wonderful and included in the room rate. There is secure underground parking provided for a fee, located about 1 1/2 blocks away. I'll definitely stay here again when we return to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Pic'n'dor
Reviews.Content: The reception by staff was poor in a tiny reception area. We got no help with our bags. The rooms are dull and I don't understand why the hotel raves about its "English" draperies. The window openings were small and the heat unbearable. There is no airconditioning. We stayed one hour of our four night booking. In a great location, but stay somewhere else. Berlin just doesn't get the small luxury hotel market.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a neighbourhood! Hackeescher Markt Hotel is in a fabulous and trendy part of Berlin. I booked our reservation by phone. The location is great for sight seeing and shopping. Our room was quiet, bright and clean. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. There is a cozy bar just beside the lobby with big windows. The staff was helpful and friendly. We joined a New Berlin walking tour at the New Synagogue- just down the street. Our English-speaking tour guide (Kristian) was originally from Toronto. He took us through the old Jewish Neighbourhood and other parts of Mitte. He was extremely friendly, knowledgeable and entertaining. His knowledge of Berlin and European History was impressive. After our four hour tour, he dropped us off at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is The place!”
Reviews.Author: m1128
Reviews.Content: T My wife and I recently (May, 2006) spent eight days in Berlin where we stayed at this gem of a small botique hotel. If you are looking to spend in the $ 175.00-$ 200.00 per night range, you can not beat this place. The staff of Michael, Thorsten, Sabrina and their associates could not do enough for us. They suggested great restaurants and interesting places to see as well as provided us with easy directions. I would recommend getting a room facing the interior garden. It is quieter and nicer than the alternatives. While I am sure one can get less expensive rooms in Berlin, Hackeshcer Markt is well worth every Euro! The location is fantastic--a short walk to all the museums on Museum Isle, 20 minutes or so from the Brandenburg gate and Eastern boundary of the Tiergarten, directly near (2 minutes away) from a major S-bahn stop, five minutes away from where the boats leave for rides on the River Spree , just off a very happenin' square, and ten minutes from the Neue Synagogue The breakfast alone is worth about $ 25.00 per person and can last (if you want) until dinner. I have rarely been treated better at any place I have stayed in the over 40 years I have travelled in Europe. Arnold Miller Pittsburgh,Pa.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: oneofmanytravelers
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews are accurate. Hotel would be perfect were it not for the breakfast charge for th unwary. It is $18 per person

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located by a train station and a great square with restaurants and outdoor cafe's. We upgraded to a suite and really enjoyed ourselves. Breakfast was wonderful and was included. Our travel company has used this hotel with good success before and we are happy they booked us there.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Ohms
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location but the rooms are very small - ask for a room overlooking the courtyard. Staff were okay but a few things really annoyed us - asked for some extra towels which didn't come until the next day, front door was locked and had to wait 15 minutes to be let in (not good when you need to catch a flight), NO 24 HOUR BAR AS ADVERTISED. Breakfast was also not included.

Reviews.Title: “Friends in the heart of the storm”
Reviews.Author: TimeCatcher
Reviews.Content: My travels lead me to Berlin on a monthly basis, I just found this Island of peace and friendship amidst one of the new vibrating touristy hotspots. A small house (30something rooms) in a classicistic building, smashingly renovated (I know the area from ten years ago!) very personal, individual rooms (try the attic!), cosy and funny backyard “garden” tables for breakfast (in summer). Not “the luxury place” but upper middle class at an extremely cool value for money ratio. Hotel has all you need, perfectly clean, tasteful interior and most important: fresh, friendly and cheerful staff – I travel a lot around the globe and haven’t enjoyed something that much for a while. So if you don’t need a big Spa, Fitness, Wellness, Boutique, chichi, etc. GO there and feel at home. And the best is: 3 S-Bahn (tram) stations away from Ostbahnhof (main station east) and about 2 min. walk from the S-Bahn station – right at the Hackescher Markt a pulsating area of history and shopping and night-out opportunities (was THE hot spot about 6 years ago and is a bit more settled now but still very enjoyable). Close to the Museum Island, Alexanderplatz and not far from the hotspot area “Prenzlauer Berg”. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “A great little find in Mitte”
Reviews.Author: Anita1967
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful 3 night stay at the Hachescher Markt hotel. Hotel in a fantastic location - within walking distance of Hachescher Hof courtyards, cafes, bars, restaurants, river. Brandenburg Gate about a 30 minute stroll away down Unter der Linden. We didn't need to use public transport once apart from taxis to and from the airport. Rooms are very clean and a good size. Bathrooms are modern. Remember to ask for a room at the back of the hotel overlooking the courtyard rather than the front. Don't let the trams parked outside the front of the hotel put you off. Bar wasn't open when we stayed but this doesn't matter as there is such a choice on your doorstep. Breakfasts are fab - a great selection and fresh food. Staff are very friendly and speak good English. Had a wonderful meal at the Noodle Bar overlooking the river and the very impressive Berliner Dom - about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. We didn't realise it was part of the Radisson chain but the interior was very modern, staff extremely friendly and they had a wonderful cigar lounge at the back of the bar. Would definitely go back to this hotel - location, location, location as well as friendly service!

HotelInfo.Name: Hackescher Markt Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Grosse Praesidenten Str 8, 10178 Berlin, Germany
